actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S.Res. 398 (Sen. Collins):
        A resolution designating the week of September 25 through September 29, 2023, as "National Clean Energy Week".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 399 (Sen. Boozman):
        A resolution expressing support for the designation of October 1 through October 7, 2023, as "National 4-H Week".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 400 (Sen. Padilla):
        A resolution honoring the life and legacy of Dianne Feinstein, the late Senator for the State of California.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 401 (Sen. Wicker):
        A resolution honoring the life, legacy, and contributions of James William Buffett.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 402 (Sen. Hoeven):
        A resolution designating October 26, 2023, as the "Day of the Deployed".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 403 (Sen. Boozman):
        A resolution recognizing the 10th anniversary of the USA Rice-Ducks Unlimited Rice Stewardship Partnership.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 404 (Sen. Shaheen):
        A resolution designating October 4, 2023, as "Energy Efficiency Day" in celebration of the economic and environmental benefits that have been driven by private sector innovation and Federal energy efficiency policies.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 405 (Sen. Brown):
        A resolution expressing support for the designation of September 30, 2023, as "National Veterans Suicide Prevention Day".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

PN65:
        Karla Ann Gilbride, of Maryland, to be General Counsel of the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission for a term of four years

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.


 PN451:
        Brendan Abell Hurson, of Maryland, to be United States District Judge for the District of Maryland

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 54 - 44. Record Vote Number: 250 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 44. Record Vote Number: 251 



 PN589:
        Susan Kim DeClercq, of Michigan, to be United States District Judge for the Eastern District of Michigan

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 54 - 44. Record Vote Number: 252 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 42. Record Vote Number: 253 



 PN590:
        Julia Kathleen Munley, of Pennsylvania, to be United States District Judge for the Middle District of Pennsylvania

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.


 PN676:
        James C. O'Brien, of Nebraska, to be an Assistant Secretary of State (European and Eurasian Affairs)

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 67 - 31. Record Vote Number: 249 



 PN812:
        Jennifer L. Hall, of Pennsylvania, to be United States District Judge for the District of Delaware

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, debate 10/16/2023.
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Schumer, at  9:21 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until  9:45 a.m. on Friday, October 6, 2023.
